speaker: First Lord
text_entry: SCENE VII. Florence. The Widow's house.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Enter HELENA and Widow

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: If you misdoubt me that I am not she,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I know not how I shall assure you further,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But I shall lose the grounds I work upon.

speaker: Widow
text_entry: Though my estate be fallen, I was well born,

speaker: Widow
text_entry: Nothing acquainted with these businesses;

speaker: Widow
text_entry: And would not put my reputation now

speaker: Widow
text_entry: In any staining act.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Nor would I wish you.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: First, give me trust, the count he is my husband,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And what to your sworn counsel I have spoken

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Is so from word to word; and then you cannot,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: By the good aid that I of you shall borrow,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Err in bestowing it.

speaker: Widow
text_entry: I should believe you:

speaker: Widow
text_entry: For you have show'd me that which well approves

speaker: Widow
text_entry: You're great in fortune.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Take this purse of gold,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And let me buy your friendly help thus far,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Which I will over-pay and pay again

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: When I have found it. The count he wooes your daughter,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Lays down his wanton siege before her beauty,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Resolved to carry her: let her in fine consent,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: As we'll direct her how 'tis best to bear it.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Now his important blood will nought deny

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: That she'll demand: a ring the county wears,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: That downward hath succeeded in his house

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: From son to son, some four or five descents

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Since the first father wore it: this ring he holds

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: In most rich choice; yet in his idle fire,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: To buy his will, it would not seem too dear,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Howe'er repented after.

speaker: Widow
text_entry: Now I see

speaker: Widow
text_entry: The bottom of your purpose.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: You see it lawful, then: it is no more,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But that your daughter, ere she seems as won,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Desires this ring; appoints him an encounter;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: In fine, delivers me to fill the time,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Herself most chastely absent: after this,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: To marry her, I'll add three thousand crowns

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: To what is passed already.

speaker: Widow
text_entry: I have yielded:

speaker: Widow
text_entry: Instruct my daughter how she shall persever,

speaker: Widow
text_entry: That time and place with this deceit so lawful

speaker: Widow
text_entry: May prove coherent. Every night he comes

speaker: Widow
text_entry: With musics of all sorts and songs composed

speaker: Widow
text_entry: To her unworthiness: it nothing steads us

speaker: Widow
text_entry: To chide him from our eaves; for he persists

speaker: Widow
text_entry: As if his life lay on't.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Why then to-night

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Let us assay our plot; which, if it speed,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Is wicked meaning in a lawful deed

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And lawful meaning in a lawful act,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Where both not sin, and yet a sinful fact:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But let's about it.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Exeunt
